Title: Overview of cell-type taxonomy, sampling, and embedding structure across development

Main.a: Developmental timeline summarizing sampled ages and key experimental events. Horizontal segments indicate the duration of each event, colored by event type, and aligned to discrete developmental age levels on the x-axis.
Main.b: Hierarchical cell-type tree from class to subclass to cluster, visualized as a dendrogram with nodes colored by class (top), the corresponding number of cells per cluster (middle), and total cell counts per class stratified by modality (bottom)
Main.c-f: UMAP embedding of all cells colored by class (c), subclass (d), cluster (e), and subcluster (f), illustrating the hierarchical organization of the taxonomy in the low-dimensional space.
Main.g-i: The same UMAP embedding colored by developmental age (g), binned or synchronized age (h), and pseudotime (i), showing the relationship between cell-state progression and developmental timing.
Main.j: Constellation-style representation of subclusters in UMAP space, where points denote subcluster centroids colored by class and edges connect each centroid to its k nearest neighbors, highlighting inter-subcluster relationships and class-level organization.
